perturbation.original_text: As consideration for the services to be provided by Wildform hereunder, On2 will pay Wildform a total of (i) $160,000 payable as follows: (a) $22,500 per month for each of the four (4) months following the Effective Date and $10,000 per month for each of the fifth and sixth months following the Effective Date with the first payment being payable 30 days from the Effective Date, and each subsequent payment payable within thirty (30) days of the preceding payment and (b) $50,000 upon On2's acceptance of the Deliverables pursuant to Section 3.1 hereof; and (ii) the Payment Shares, issuable upon the 12-month anniversary of the Effective Date. The foregoing notwithstanding, the payment provided for in this Article IV is not intended to constitute consideration for the Purchased Assets and Licensed Assets, payment for the license of which is provided for in the Asset Purchase Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: As consideration for the services to be provided by Wildform hereunder, On2 will pay Wildform a total of (i) $160,000 payable as follows: (a) $22,500 per month for each of the four (4) months following the Effective Date and $10,000 per month for each of the fifth and sixth months following the Effective Date with the first payment being payable 30 days from the Effective Date, and each subsequent payment payable within thirty (30) days of the preceding payment and (b) $50,000 upon On2's acceptance of the Deliverables pursuant to Section 3.1 hereof, with a further 30-day grace period; and (ii) the Payment Shares, issuable upon the 12-month anniversary of the Effective Date. The foregoing notwithstanding, the payment provided for in this Article IV is not intended to constitute consideration for the Purchased Assets and Licensed Assets, payment for the license of which is provided for in the Asset Purchase Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Adding "with a further 30-day grace period" to the payment terms creates a contradiction. The original text implies payments are due within 30 days of the previous payment, while the addition suggests a grace period exists, which could be interpreted as extending the deadline. This introduces ambiguity regarding the actual due date and when late payment penalties would apply.

perturbation.original_text:
During the first twelve (12) months of the Term, Wildform will provide On2 with reasonable technical support for the Deliverables via phone and email during Wildform's normal business hours with respect to the following:

      o     Train On2 personnel in the way the code works.

      o     Train On2 personnel in how the software is designed, maintained and             compiled.

      o     Provide ongoing support during the 12-month term for On2's further             development and integration.

The foregoing obligations of Wildform shall be limited to a maximum of forty (40) hours, or up to a maximum of two hundred twenty (220) emails, whichever accumulates first.
perturbation.changed_text:
During the first twelve (12) months of the Term, Wildform will provide On2 with reasonable technical support for the Deliverables via phone and email during Wildform's normal business hours with respect to the following:

      o     Train On2 personnel in the way the code works.

      o     Train On2 personnel in how the software is designed, maintained and             compiled.

      o     Provide ongoing support during the 12-month term for On2's further             development and integration; this includes unlimited consultation calls.

The foregoing obligations of Wildform shall be limited to a maximum of forty (40) hours, or up to a maximum of two hundred twenty (220) emails, whichever accumulates first.
perturbation.explanation: By adding 'this includes unlimited consultation calls', a contradiction is created. The overall support is limited to 40 hours/220 emails, yet unlimited consultation calls are promised. This creates uncertainty on whether calls are separate from the hour/email limits, leading to potential disputes on what constitutes 'reasonable technical support'.

perturbation.original_text:
Delayed delivery by Wildform of the above listed Deliverables shall not be considered a violation of this Agreement, provided that Wildform has worked in good faith to provide the Deliverables in a timely fashion, provided however,

that failure to deliver (a) the Flix Pro Windows Deliverables prior to the 91-day anniversary of delivery of the Flash 8 Materials to Wildform or (ii) all of the Deliverables prior to the 270-day anniversary of the delivery of the Flash 8 Materials to Wildform, shall be considered a violation of this Agreement..
perturbation.changed_text: Delayed delivery by Wildform of the above listed Deliverables shall not be considered a violation of this Agreement, regardless of the reason for the delay, provided that Wildform has worked in good faith to provide the Deliverables. However, if there is a significant lack of communication regarding the status of the Deliverables, then this can be deemed a violation of this Agreement, at the discretion of On2.
perturbation.explanation: The original text provided clear deadlines after which failure to deliver would be a violation. The modified text removes those deadlines, stating that delayed delivery is *not* a violation, but then contradicts itself by saying a lack of communication *can* be a violation (with no specific measure), placing the decision solely at On2's discretion. This lacks clarity and creates an enforcement conflict.
